location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Jaffer Ali Khan

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has left a hole in f. 44 that has obscured some of the body of the letter. As a result, some of the text is a little tricky to read in this area.

mods.abstract: The letter is informing Jaffer Ali Khan [Ja‘afar ‘Alī Khān] that the Resident would have replied to his letters sooner, but for the fact he has been expecting him to appear at Bushire in person. It concerns Jaffer Ali Khan's mission to acquire a packet, but does not go into great detail. The Resident also explains that he has also refused to pay the cossid Esmael [Ismā’īl] for delivery of Jaffer Ali Khan's last letter, since he believes that he has taken too long to deliver it.
